record.title: ORDERS FOR FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 2, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 2, 2007 -- (Senate - November 01, 2007)

[Page: S13714]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until tomorrow morning at 10 a.m.; that on Friday, following the prayer and the pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day, and that there then be a period for the transaction of morning business with Senators permitted to speak therein for up to 10 minutes each.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
